Cvars.help: Starts a new named test. These can be nested

Cvars.name: Test_EndTest
Cvars.help: Ends a previously started test.

Cvars.name: Test_FloatTime
Cvars.help: Returns the current application time in seconds

Cvars.name: Test_HostFrame
Cvars.help: Returns the current host frame

Cvars.name: Test_Loop
Cvars.help: Test_Loop <loop name> - loop back to the specified loop start point unconditionally.

Cvars.name: Test_LoopCount
Cvars.help: Test_LoopCount <loop name> <count> - loop back to the specified loop start point the specified # of times.

Cvars.help: Test_LoopForNumSeconds <loop name> <time> - loop back to the specified start point for the specified # of seconds.

Cvars.name: Test_RandomChance
Cvars.help: Test_RandomChance <percent chance, 0-100> <token1> <token2...> - Roll the dice and maybe run the command following the percentage chance.

Cvars.name: Test_RecordCommand
Cvars.help: Records a command result into the results log of the current test.

Cvars.name: Test_RecordMessage
Cvars.help: Records a message into the results log of the current test (See Test_BeginTest)

Cvars.name: Test_RunFrame
Cvars.help: Waits until the next frame to continue. Same as Test_WaitForCheckPoint frame_end

Cvars.name: Test_StartLoop
Cvars.help: Test_StartLoop <loop name> - Denote the start of a loop. Really just defines a named point you can jump to.

Cvars.name: Test_StartScript
Cvars.help: Start a test script running..

Cvars.name: Test_TakeScreenshot
Cvars.help: Takes a screenshot and saves it into the results directory

Cvars.name: Test_Wait
Cvars.help: Waits for a number number of seconds, then continues test execution

Cvars.name: Test_WaitForCheckPoint

Cvars.name: Test_WaitFrames

Cvars.name: ai_debug_actbusy
Cvars.help:
Used to debug actbusy behavior. Usage:
1: Constantly draw lines from NPCs to the actbusy nodes they've chosen to actbusy at.
2: Whenever an NPC makes a decision to use an actbusy, show which actbusy they've chosen.
3: Selected NPCs (with npc_select) will report why they're not choosing actbusy nodes.
4: Display debug output of actbusy logic.
5: Display safe zone volumes and info.

Cvars.name: ai_debug_dyninteractions
Cvars.help: Debug the NPC dynamic interaction system.

Cvars.name: ai_debug_eventresponses
Cvars.help: Set to 1 to see all NPC response events trigger, and which NPCs choose to respond to them.

Cvars.name: ai_debug_expressions
Cvars.help: Show random expression decisions for NPCs.

Cvars.name: ai_debug_los
Cvars.help: NPC Line-Of-Sight debug mode. If 1, solid entities that block NPC LOC will be highlighted with white bounding boxes. If 2, it'll show non-solid entities that would do it if they were solid.

Cvars.name: ai_debug_node_connect
Cvars.help: Debug the attempted connection between two nodes

Cvars.name: ai_disable
Cvars.help: Bi-passes all AI logic routines and puts all NPCs into their idle animations.  Can be used to get NPCs out of your way and to test effect of AI logic routines on frame rate

Cvars.name: ai_drop_hint
Cvars.help: Drop an ai_hint at the player's current eye position.

Cvars.name: ai_expression_frametime
Cvars.help: Maximum frametime to still play background expressions.

Cvars.name: ai_expression_optimization
Cvars.help: Disable npc background expressions when you can't see them.

Cvars.name: ai_frametime_limit
Cvars.help: frametime limit for min efficiency AIE_NORMAL (in sec's).

Cvars.name: ai_hull
Cvars.help:
Controls which connections are shown when ai_show_hull or ai_show_connect commands are used
	Arguments:	NPC name or classname, <none>=NPC under crosshair

Cvars.name: ai_nav_debug_experimental_pathing
Cvars.help: Draw paths tried during search for bodysnatcher pathing

Cvars.name: ai_next_hull
Cvars.help:
Cycles through the various hull sizes.  Currently selected hull size is written to the screen.  Controls which connections are shown when ai_show_hull or ai_show_connect commands are used
	Arguments:	-none-

Cvars.name: ai_nodes
Cvars.help:
Toggles node display.  First call displays the nodes for the given network as green objects.  Second call  displays the nodes and their IDs.  Nodes are color coded as follows:
	Green		- ground node
	Cyan		- air node
	Magenta	- climb node
	Grey		- node not available for selected hull size
	Orange 	- node currently locked

Cvars.name: ai_rebuildmessages
Cvars.help: Shows nodegraph rebuild messages when enabled.

Cvars.name: ai_resume
Cvars.help: If NPC is stepping through tasks (see ai_step ) will resume normal processing.

Cvars.name: ai_set_move_height_epsilon
Cvars.help: Set how high AI bumps up ground walkers when checking steps

Cvars.name: ai_setenabled
Cvars.help: Like ai_disable but you manually specify the state (with a 0 or 1) instead of toggling it.

Cvars.name: ai_setupbones_debug
Cvars.help: Shows that bones that are setup every think

Cvars.name: ai_show_connect
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

Cvars.name: ai_show_connect_crawl
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

Cvars.name: ai_show_connect_fly
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

Cvars.name: ai_show_connect_jump
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement

Cvars.name: ai_show_graph_connect
Cvars.help: Toggles graph connection display for the node that the player is looking at.  Nodes that are connected to the selected node by the net graph will be drawn in red with magenta lines connecting to the selected node.  Nodes that are not connected via the net graph from the selected node will be drawn in blue.

Cvars.name: ai_show_grid
Cvars.help: Draw a grid on the floor where looking.

Cvars.name: ai_show_hints
Cvars.help:
Displays all hints as small boxes
	Blue		- hint is available for use
	Red		- hint is currently being used by an NPC
	Orange		- hint not being used by timed out
	Grey		- hint has been disabled

Cvars.name: ai_show_hull
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed hulls between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Arguments: 	-none-

Cvars.name: ai_show_node
Cvars.help: Highlight the specified node

Cvars.name: ai_show_visibility
Cvars.help: Toggles visibility display for the node that the player is looking at.  Nodes that are visible from the selected node will be drawn in red with yellow lines connecting to the selected node.  Nodes that are not visible from the selected node will be drawn in blue.

Cvars.name: ai_step

Cvars.help: If set, attempt to keep a persistent buffer for the LZMA decoder dictionary. This avoids re-allocating a ~16-64meg buffer for each operation, at the expensive of keeping extra memory around when it is not in-use.

Cvars.name: m_customaccel
Cvars.help:
Custom mouse acceleration:
0: custom accelaration disabled
1: mouse_acceleration = min(m_customaccel_max, pow(raw_mouse_delta, m_customaccel_exponent) * m_customaccel_scale + sensitivity)
2: Same as 1, with but x and y sensitivity are scaled by m_pitch and m_yaw respectively.
3: mouse_acceleration = pow(raw_mouse_delta, m_customaccel_exponent - 1) * sensitivity

Cvars.name: m_customaccel_exponent
Cvars.help: Mouse move is raised to this power before being scaled by scale factor.

Cvars.name: m_customaccel_max
Cvars.help: Max mouse move scale factor, 0 for no limit

Cvars.name: m_customaccel_scale
Cvars.help: Custom mouse acceleration value.

Cvars.name: m_filter

Cvars.name: m_forward

Cvars.name: m_limitedcapture_workaround

Cvars.name: m_mouseaccel1

Cvars.name: m_mouseaccel2
Cvars.help: Windows mouse acceleration secondary threshold (4x movement).

Cvars.name: m_mousespeed
Cvars.help: Windows mouse acceleration (0 to disable, 1 to enable [Windows 2000: enable initial threshold], 2 to enable secondary threshold [Windows 2000 only]).

Cvars.name: m_pitch

Cvars.name: m_pitch2

Cvars.name: m_pitch_inverse

Keep in mind that a color value gets multiplied on top, so this should be mostly white or light gray for the best effect.
Requires reloading the map.

Cvars.name: mat_fxaa_edge_sharpness_C
Cvars.help: Does not affect PS3 which uses FXAA_CONSOLE_PS3_EDGE_SHARPNESS define due to being ALU bound (and only safe values are 2, 4, 8). On X360, (2.0 - really soft, good for vector graphics inputs), (4.0 - is softer), (8.0 - is sharper, default)

Cvars.name: mat_fxaa_edge_threshold_C
Cvars.help: Does not affect PS3 which uses FXAA_CONSOLE_PS3_EDGE_THRESHOLD define due to being ALU bound (and only safe values are 1/4, 1/8). On X360, (0.125 - default, leaves less aliasing, but is softer, 0.25 - leaves more aliasing and is sharper)

Cvars.name: mat_fxaa_edge_threshold_Q
Cvars.help: The minimum amount of local contrast required to apply algorithm: (0.063 - overkill, slower), (0.125 - high quality), (0.166 - default), (0.250 - low quality), (0.333 - too little, faster)

Cvars.name: mat_fxaa_edge_threshold_min_C
Cvars.help: Trims the algorithm from processing darks. Does not affect PS3 due to being ALU bound. (0.04 - slower and less aliasing in darks, 0.05 - default, 0.06 - faster but more aliasing in darks). Special note: when using FXAA_GREEN_AS_LUMA likely want to set this to zero

Cvars.name: mat_fxaa_edge_threshold_min_Q
Cvars.help: Trims the algorithm from processing darks: (0.0312 - visible limit, slower), (0.0625 - high quality, faster), (0.0833 - upper limit, the start of fisible unfiltered edges). Special note: when using FXAA_GREEN_AS_LUMA, likely want to set this to zero

Cvars.name: mat_fxaa_subpixel_C
Cvars.help: Effects sub-pixel AA quality and inversely sharpness (only used on FXAA Console): (0.33 - sharper), (0.5 - default)

Cvars.name: mat_fxaa_subpixel_Q
Cvars.help: Effects sub-pixel AA quality and inversely sharpness (only used on FXAA Quality): (0.0 - off), (1.0 - upper limit, softer), default = 0.75

Cvars.help: Max length of completely occluded shadow to consider a player for occlusion test. If shadow provably stops at this distance, the player may be considered for occlusion test. For longer shadows, we just don't do occlusion because we are not likely to find full occlusion when one of the boxes is expanded too much.
